elements: Most of these islands are well-known to the Histories, but our destination lies in wild uncharted reaches. We'll need Heart or Forge to survive.
Hidden Doors can be found with Lantern or Knock.
An engineer, or an adept, has ensured this door will not open easily. Forge or Knock will defeat it.
The Mother of Ants was born among serpents. She has so very many younger sisters. It can be defeated in battle; or it will respond to the Mother's power.
Mortals. Perhaps even ordinary mortals. But quite a number of them. They can be fought, seduced, or deceived.
Contemplatives blessed or condemned to service here. They're bound by their curious vows. We can murder them, or deceive them, but they will not be seduced.
Not all the Dead rest easy. These ones dislike our intrusion. We can prevail against them with Edge; or they may obey one who comes in the name of Winter.

One might mistake them for old women, until they discard their skins. The place is aswarm with them,. They are strong as strangling roots, and at least half-Long, but they can be deceived, and they are very wary of light.
It is very hard to kill anyone who's passed the Tricuspid Door. And here are quite a lot of anyones. But perhaps we can deceive one, or prey upon someone's appetites.
We need Heart or Lantern to suppress this curse. Otherwise, it will not keep us from our goal, but it may trouble us later.
We need Heart or Winter to suppress this curse. Otherwise, it will not keep us from our goal, but it may trouble us later.
We need Heart or Grail to suppress this curse. Otherwise, it will not keep us from our goal, but it may trouble us later.
We need Lantern or Moth to suppress this curse. Otherwise, it will not keep us from our goal, but it may trouble us later.
